sentence.Network_en: The Philharmonia played this staggeringly difficult music superlatively well.
sentence.Network_cn: 爱乐乐团精彩演绎了这首高难度乐曲。
那支管弦乐队演奏得非常好.

sentence.Network_en: The superlatively discreet foreign - exchange banker diversified from the very beginning, selling antiques and procuring loans.
sentence.Network_cn: 过度谨慎的外汇银行家从最初就在搞多元化,兼营古玩和获取贷款.

近似字词-新浪字典 ... superlaser 高能镭射 superlatively 最高地;无比地 superlattice 超晶格.

list.abs: I cannot recall a single author of whom I have read everything-even of Jane Austen . I have never never seen Susan and The Watsons , one of which I have been told is superlatively good .我不记得曾否读完任何一位作家的全部著作，即使简·奥斯汀也不例外。我从未看过《苏珊》和《沃森一家》，其中有一本是绝好的书。
adver... ... interrogative adverb 疑问副词 superlative adverb n. 副词最高级 adverb group 副词组(指以一个副词为基础的词组).
craftsmanship的... ... 匠心 ingenuity;craftsmanship 鬼斧神工 superlative craftsmanship 技巧 skill;technique;craftsmanship.
博客来书籍馆&gt;英文... ... 比较级的比较 Comparative Degree 最高级的比较 Superlative Degree 倍数的比较 Multiple Numerals.
新概念笔记册 -... ... He is nothing but liar. 他是骗子 superlative degree 名词的最高级 leading role 主角.

entry.tran: 极佳的;最优秀的;卓越的
entry.def: If you describe something as superlative, you mean that it is extremely good.

example.ex: Some superlative wines are made in this region...
example.tran: 一些上好的葡萄酒就是在这个地区酿造的。

example.ex: The Regent hotel has a superlative view of Hong Kong island.
example.tran: 在丽晶酒店看香港岛的美景，视野绝佳。

entry.def: If someone uses superlatives to describe something, they use adjectives and expressions which indicate that it is extremely good.

example.ex: ...a spectacle which has critics world-wide reaching for superlatives.
example.tran: 世界各地的评论家们都极尽溢美之词夸赞不已的盛况

entry.def: In grammar, the superlative form of an adjective or adverb is the form that indicates that something has more of a quality than anything else in a group. For example, 'biggest' is the superlative form of 'big'.
